result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle M Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in court with attorney Frank Lettenberger and Mackenzie Renner. ADA Crawford appears for SOW. Partial agreement. Agreement in 20CF32; Argued sentence in 20CF222.
Atty Lettenberger recites agreement. Clarification as to sentence. Amended Information filed on 20CF32. Prior convictions noted.
Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. 

20CF32 (OWI 3rd) 
Guilty plea to count #4; remaining counts dismissed and read in.
Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant. Deportation warning given. Court finds factual basis and finds defendant guilty.

20CF222 OWI 4th
Guilty plea to count #1; remaining counts dismisses and read in.
Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant. Court gives deportation warning, firearm possession and voter ineligibility. Court finds factual basis and finds defendant guilty.


Court to proceed to sentencing on OWI 4th case 20CF222
913 am Sentencing argument by ADA Crawford and requesting prison consecutive to 20CF32
919 am Sentencing argument by Atty Lettenberger and requesting treatment court

928 am Defendant makes statement to the court

929 am Court goes over sentencing factors / objectives

Court sentences defendant to OWI treatment court on 20CF222. Court will not impose and stay sentence on this case. 



20CF32 count #4
SENTENCE
270 days Walworth County Jail with Huber privileges
$1800.00 fine plus costs
30 months license revocation
30 months IID requirement
AODA and follow through
DNA sample/surcharge
Restitution - Claim is in 19CT475

20CF222 count #1
SENTENCE 
18months probation - OWI COURT sentence
30 days conditional jail with work release privileges, Consecutive to 20CF32
Standard OWI court conditions.


Remaining counts on 20CF32 & 20CF222 - Dismissed and read in.
19CT475, 20CT521, 20CF571, 19TR3602, 20TR1541, 20TR1542, 20TR1543 & 20TR1545 - Dismissed and read in.


Court in recess at 946 am.

Defendant Michelle M Smith in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Michelle M Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties reached an agreement that both sides are free to argue and a PSI to be ordered on felony case. Minutes filed.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle M Smith in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Michelle M Smith. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle M Smith in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Michelle M Smith. Victim also present in court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

8:40 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle M Smith in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Michelle M Smith. 
Atty Lettenberger asks for 30 days. 
Status hearing set for July 28, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560
Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

3:06 PM Defendant Michelle M Smith in court. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Andrew Herrmann in court.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Michelle M Smith. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
Attorney Kim acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Adj. 3:07 PM

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle M Smith in court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Tony Kim
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22CF75, 20CF222, 20CF32, 19CT475, 20CT521 & 20CF571

Must post $1000.00 cash (already posted)

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): America's Liquor L.L.C. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michelle M Smith appeared in court. Attorney options form given, defendant referred to SPD. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Attorney Lettenberger not on this case. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
